Movies to Look Out for in 2026

Executive Summary

The year 2026 promises an exciting slate of movies across various genres, with a notable emphasis on blockbuster franchises, innovative sci-fi films, and a resurgence in animated features. Major studios are set to release sequels and adaptations of beloved properties such as Avengers: Doomsday, The Mandalorian and Grogu, and Dune: Part Three, alongside fresh original projects from acclaimed directors like Steven Spielberg and Christopher Nolan. The animation sector is particularly vibrant, featuring anticipated releases like Toy Story 5, Minions 3, and Pixar’s Hoppers, signaling a potential revival in the genre. Sci-fi enthusiasts have much to look forward to with films exploring diverse themes from dystopian futures to cosmic adventures. Additionally, the DC Universe and Marvel Cinematic Universe continue to expand with new entries that promise to deepen their respective mythologies. This report provides a comprehensive overview of the most anticipated films of 2026, categorized by genre and theme, offering insights into release schedules, key cast members, and creative teams.

Major Blockbusters and Franchise Films

Superhero and Comic Book Adaptations

  • Avengers: Doomsday (Dec 18, 2026) –

    • The next chapter in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, featuring the return of Robert Downey Jr. as Doctor Doom and the integration of X-Men characters, promising a monumental storyline that spans the multiverse [1].

  • Supergirl (Jun 26, 2026) –

    • Directed by Craig Gillespie, this DC Universe film explores the cosmic adventures of Kara Zor-El, expanding the DCU beyond Earth-centric narratives with a star-studded cast including Milly Alcock and Jason Momoa [2].

  • Spider-Man: Brand New Day (Jul 31, 2026) –

    • Tom Holland returns as Peter Parker, balancing college life and superhero duties, facing new threats with unexpected allies [1].

  • Lanterns (Late Summer 2026) –

    • An HBO Max series focusing on the Green Lantern Corps, starring Kyle Chandler and Aaron Pierre, blending detective drama with sci-fi elements within the DCU [3].

  • Clayface (Sep 11, 2026) –

    • A horror-thriller spin-off centered on the Batman villain Clayface, directed by James Watkins, aiming to attract audiences beyond the superhero genre [3].

Other Franchise Highlights

  • The Mandalorian and Grogu (May 22, 2026) –

    • Lucasfilm’s first Star Wars theatrical film in seven years, continuing the adventures of Din Djarin and Grogu, promising a blend of action and heartfelt storytelling [1][4].

  • Dune: Part Three (Dec 18, 2026) –

    • Denis Villeneuve returns to the epic sci-fi saga, exploring new narrative territory beyond the original novel, with Timothée Chalamet and Zendaya reprising their roles [1][4].

  • 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple (Jan 16, 2026) –

    • Directed by Nia DaCosta, this sequel continues the post-apocalyptic horror saga, delving into themes of superstition and survival [1][5].

  • Scream 7 (Feb 27, 2026) –

    • Sidney Prescott returns to confront a new Ghostface killer in this continuation of the iconic horror franchise [1].

  • Mortal Kombat II (May 15, 2026) –

    • The sequel to the 2021 reboot, featuring returning characters and new challenges in this martial arts fantasy [1].

Noteworthy Sci-Fi Films

  • Project Hail Mary (Mar 20, 2026) –

    • Directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, starring Ryan Gosling, this adaptation of Andy Weir’s novel follows an astronaut on a mission to save Earth from an existential threat [6][7].

  • Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die (Feb 13, 2026) –

    • A sci-fi comedy featuring time travel and a dystopian future, starring Sam Rockwell, praised for its humor and visual style [6].

  • Flowervale Street (Aug 14, 2026) –

    • Directed by David Robert Mitchell, this sci-fi mystery involves time travel and dinosaurs, with Anne Hathaway and Ewan McGregor leading the cast [6].

  • The Dog Stars (Mar 27, 2026) –

    • Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Peter Heller’s novel, set in a post-pandemic world, exploring survival and companionship [6].

  • Disclosure Day (Jun 12, 2026) –

    • Steven Spielberg’s UFO-themed sci-fi film featuring Emily Blunt and Josh O’Connor, focusing on the revelation of alien intelligence [6].

Top Animated Movies to Expect in 2026

  • Toy Story 5 (Jun 19, 2026) –

    • Pixar’s continuation of the beloved franchise, addressing the challenges toys face in a digital age, with returning voice actors including Tom Hanks [8][9].

  • Minions 3 (Jul 1, 2026) –

    • Illumination’s latest installment in the Despicable Me franchise, continuing the misadventures of the beloved Minions [8][9].

  • The Super Mario Galaxy Movie (Apr 3, 2026) –

    • A sequel to the 2023 Super Mario Bros. Movie, exploring the cosmic adventures inspired by the Nintendo Wii game, featuring returning cast members [8][10].

  • Hoppers (Mar 6, 2026) –

    • Pixar’s original sci-fi comedy about a young woman who transfers her consciousness into a robotic beaver, blending humor with environmental themes [8][9].

  • Animal Farm (May 1, 2026) –

    • An animated adaptation of George Orwell’s classic novel, offering a visually powerful and thought-provoking story on power and corruption [8].

  • The Cat in the Hat (Nov 6, 2026) –

    • Warner Bros. Animation’s stylized adaptation of Dr. Seuss’s classic, blending 2D and CG animation, with Bill Hader voicing the titular character [8][9].

  • Wildwood (2026) –

    • Laika’s stop-motion film based on Colin Meloy’s novel, featuring a mystical forest adventure with themes of family and magic [8][9].

Emerging Trends and Industry Insights

2026 is marked by a strong presence of sequels and franchise continuations, reflecting studios’ confidence in established IPs. However, there is also a notable investment in original stories, especially within the sci-fi and animation genres, signaling a balance between commercial viability and creative innovation. The animation sector is witnessing a potential revival, with studios like Pixar, Laika, and Warner Bros. pushing boundaries through unique storytelling and diverse animation techniques. Streaming platforms continue to play a significant role in the distribution and production of genre films and series, expanding audience reach and content variety. Additionally, the integration of high-profile actors and directors in genre films underscores the growing mainstream appeal of science fiction and fantasy narratives [6][8][9].
